metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7810 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Expression Language (EL) implementation in Apache Tomcat 6.x before 6.0.44, 7.x before 7.0.58, and 8.x before 8.0.16 does not properly consider the possibility of an accessible interface implemented by an inaccessible class, which allows attackers to bypass a SecurityManager protection mechanism via a web application that leverages use of incorrect privileges during EL evaluation. It was discovered that the Tomcat Expression Language (EL) implementation incorrectly handled accessible interfaces implemented by inaccessible classes. An attacker could possibly use this issue to bypass a SecurityManager protection mechanism.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet2.4-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
libtomcat6-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6 - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-admin - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-common - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-examples - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-extras - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-user - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1').
tomcat7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3').
